channel.title: Please help guys this could be my last ?!
channel.description:
Okay so I'm making a webclient and this is what I'v done. [size=14pt]I jarred my client![/size] [img]http://oi43.tinypic.com/4l11j8.jpg[/img] Is the Manifest thing correct? It's a Pi server. [size=14pt]I signed my client![/size] [img]http://oi42.tinypic.com/jfklfs.jpg[/img] [size=14pt]This is what I came up with after I jarred and signed it![/size] [img]http://oi44.tinypic.com/2isuw7r.jpg[/img] [size=14pt]I ran my client with the jar, and this came up :([/size] [img]http://oi44.tinypic.com/qou590.jpg[/img] [size=14pt]I ran it with my run.bat and this is what it said in the CMD[/size]
THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY DOUBLE-CLICK THE "client.jar" TO RUN IT - Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/) C:\Users\Buffenbarger\Desktop>java -jar client.jar java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\ErasedPkzcache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:81) at client.startUp(client.java:8866) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6074) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:53) at Update.(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4778) at client.startUp(client.java:8876) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6074) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
And ideas on how to fix it? Rep++ and much appreciation if you can help me solve :), I'll also give you unlimited donor on my serv :D

item.title: Please help guys this could be my last ?!
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

b00mz1029:

How do I make it so the signlink goes straight to my cache

Shouldn’t the signlink folder be packaged within the jar file? That’s how I do it. Why put it with the cache?

Read full topic
item.source: Please help guys this could be my last ?!

item.title: Please help guys this could be my last ?!
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“b00mz1029, post:3, topic:426668”]@ECHO OFF
ECHO THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
ECHO DOUBLE-CLICK THE “client.jar” TO RUN IT
ECHO -
ECHO Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
@ECHO ON
java -jar client.jar
@ECHO OFF
pause

and Ill try the signlink thing[/quote]

[quote author=b00mz1029 link=topic=529366.msg3862636#msg3862636 date=1324761490]
@ECHO OFF
ECHO THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
ECHO DOUBLE-CLICK THE "client.jar" TO RUN IT
ECHO -
ECHO Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
@ECHO ON
java -jar -cp .; client.jar
@ECHO OFF
pause

That should fix your problem with your .Batch file.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help guys this could be my last ?!

  2. Re-write your signlink to the correct Cache path.

item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Okay so I’m making a webclient and this is what I’v done.

[size=14pt]I jarred my client![/size]

4l11j8.jpg585×601

Is the Manifest thing correct? It’s a Pi server.

[size=14pt]I signed my client![/size]

[size=14pt]This is what I came up with after I jarred and signed it![/size]

[size=14pt]I ran my client with the jar, and this came up :([/size]

qou590.jpg771×530

[size=14pt]I ran it with my run.bat and this is what it said in the CMD[/size]

THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
DOUBLE-CLICK THE “client.jar” TO RUN IT

Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)

C:\Users\Buffenbarger\Desktop>java -jar client.jar

cannot find the path specified)
